sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
In the eleaventh moneth, on the nineth day of the moneth, as I was waiting upon the Lord in the land of my nativity, the spirit of the Lord then signified unto me the second time, saying, arise and take up a lamentation over New-England; and being made willing, have writ as followeth. Browne, John, of Nevis. Braister, Margaret.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
s.n.], [London : printed in the year 1678.
Signed: John Browne of Nevis. Place of publication suggested by Wing. Includes: A warning from the great God of Heaven and Earth, to the rulers and magistrates of Boston New-England ... / [signed] Margaret Braister. Reproduction of original in the Friends' Library, London, England.
=======
In the eleaventh moneth, on the nineth day of the moneth, as I was waiting upon the Lord in the land of my nativity, the spirit of the Lord then signified unto me the second time, saying, arise and take up a lamentation over New-England; and being made willing, have writ as followeth. Browne, John, of Nevis. Braister, Margaret.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
s.n.], [London : printed in the year 1678.
Signed: John Browne of Nevis. Place of publication suggested by Wing. Includes: A warning from the great God of Heaven and Earth, to the rulers and magistrates of Boston New-England ... / [signed] Margaret Braister. Reproduction of original in the Friends' Library, London, England.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
